place.name: KIRBY CANE
place.gazetteerText: KIRBY-CANE, a village and a parish in Loddon district, Norfolk. The village stands 1½ mile NNE of Ellingham r. station, 1¾ N of the river Waveney at the boundary with Suffolk, and 3 NE of Bungay; and has a postoffice under Bungay. The parish comprises 1, 475 acres. Real property, £2, 962. Pop., 448. Houses, 92. Kirby Hall, a handsome mansion, with a fine view, and also most of the property, belong to Lord Berners. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Norwich. Value, £425.* Patron, Lord Berners. The church is ancient but good; and has a round embattled tower. There are a Wesleyan chapel, a national school, and charities £81. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
